title: Restricts the disposal of yard waste by landfill burial or incinerator
summary: Restricts the disposal of yard waste through burial in a landfill or by incinerator; exempts certain minor amounts; provides for penalties for violations; directs the department of environmental conservation to promulgate regulations to implement this provision; permits local laws not inconsistent therewith.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ENGLEBRIGHT -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Environmental Conservation

       AN ACT to amend the  environmental  conservation  law,  in  relation  to
         restrictions on the disposal of yard waste

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The environmental conservation law is amended by  adding  a
    2  new section 27-0721 to read as follows:
    3  S 27-0721. RESTRICTIONS ON THE DISPOSAL OF YARD WASTE.
    4    1. ON OR AFTER SEPTEMBER FIRST, TWO THOUSAND THIRTEEN, NO PERSON SHALL
    5  KNOWINGLY  DELIVER YARD WASTE TO A LANDFILL FOR PURPOSES OF LAND BURIAL,
    6  OR TO AN INCINERATOR FOR PURPOSES OF  COMBUSTION,  OR  DISPOSE  OF  YARD
    7  WASTE  AT A LANDFILL OR INCINERATOR. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "YARD
    8  WASTE" SHALL MEAN LEAVES, GRASS CLIPPINGS, GARDEN DEBRIS AND WOOD DEBRIS
    9  INCLUDING TREE TRUNKS AND SMALL OR CHIPPED BRANCHES.  UPON  APPLICATION,
   10  THE  COMMISSIONER  MAY,  WHEN  DEMONSTRATED  TO HIS OR HER SATISFACTION,
   11  GRANT A VARIANCE EXTENDING UNTIL SEPTEMBER FIRST, TWO THOUSAND  FIFTEEN.
   12  GRANTING  OF  SUCH  VARIANCE  SHALL  ONLY BE MADE IF BASED UPON A DEMON-
   13  STRATION BY THE APPLICANT THAT A GOOD FAITH EFFORT IS BEING MADE TO MEET
   14  THE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SECTION AND UPON A SHOWING OF HARDSHIP  DUE  TO
   15  REASONS BEYOND THE CONTROL OF THE APPLICANT.
   16    2.  EXCLUDED  FROM THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION ARE MINOR AMOUNTS OF
   17  MATERIALS AS IDENTIFIED IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION,  AS  MAY  BE
   18  PRESENT IN THE SOLID WASTE COLLECTED.
   19    3.  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, AND IN FURTHERANCE OF
   20  THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, ANY LOCAL LAW ADOPTED  BY  A  MUNICIPALITY
   21  PURSUANT  TO  SECTION ONE HUNDRED TWENTY-AA OF THE GENERAL MUNICIPAL LAW
   22  SHALL BE CONSISTENT WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.
   23    4. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL ADOPT REGULATIONS FOR  THE  IMPLEMENTATION  OF
   24  THIS SECTION AND SHALL CONSIDER THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION WITH REGARD
   25  TO ANY APPROVAL OR PERMIT REQUIRED FOR THE COLLECTION, TRANSPORTATION OR

    1  DISPOSAL  OF SOLID WASTE. SUCH REGULATIONS SHALL FURTHER PROVIDE FOR THE
    2  CLEAR DELINEATION OF RESPECTIVE RESPONSIBILITIES OF OWNERS OR  OPERATORS
    3  OF  SOLID  WASTE  FACILITIES, TRANSPORTERS AND PLANNING UNITS UNDER THIS
    4  SECTION.
    5    5.  NOTHING  CONTAINED IN THIS SECTION SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO LIMIT THE
    6  AUTHORITY OF A MUNICIPALITY TO ENACT  LOCAL  LAWS  OR  REGULATIONS,  NOT
    7  INCONSISTENT  WITH THE RULES AND REGULATIONS OF THE DEPARTMENT, IMPOSING
    8  MORE STRINGENT RESTRICTIONS ON THE DISPOSAL OF REUSABLE,  RECYCLABLE  OR
    9  COMPOSTABLE MATERIALS.
   10    S  2. Section 71-2703 of the environmental conservation law is amended
   11  by adding a new subdivision 6 to read as follows:
   12    6. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS SECTION TO THE  CONTRA-
   13  RY,  THE SANCTIONS SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISIONS ONE AND TWO OF THIS SECTION
   14  SHALL NOT APPLY TO A  VIOLATION  OF  SECTION  27-0721  OF  THIS  CHAPTER
   15  COMMITTED BY AN INDIVIDUAL RESIDENTIAL GENERATOR OF YARD WASTE. AN INDI-
   16  VIDUAL  RESIDENTIAL  GENERATOR OF YARD WASTE WHO KNOWINGLY VIOLATES SUCH
   17  SECTION 27-0721, OR ANY REGULATION PROMULGATED PURSUANT  THERETO,  SHALL
   18  BE LIABLE FOR A CIVIL PENALTY NOT TO EXCEED ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS FOR EACH
   19  SUCH  VIOLATION, TO BE ASSESSED BY THE COMMISSIONER AFTER AN OPPORTUNITY
   20  TO BE HEARD PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 71-1709 OF THIS  ARTI-
   21  CLE,  OR  BY  THE  COURT IN ANY ACTION OR PROCEEDING PURSUANT TO SECTION
   22  71-2727 OF THIS TITLE, AND, IN ADDITION  THERETO,  SUCH  PERSON  MAY  BY
   23  SIMILAR PROCESS BE ENJOINED FROM CONTINUING SUCH VIOLATION.
   24    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
